item.title: Skate To Enter Early Access On September 16
item.content:encoded:
Electronic Arts is preparing to welcome gamers to San Vansterdam from September 16 as Skate (I’m not writing skate., I hate that title) enters early access. This news was announced on social media earlier today, and it comes after months of closed testing phases have unravelled much of the game’s content.

The Skate team also released a short trailer to celebrate the announcement. It has been more than 15 years since the last Skate game was released, and fans are hungry.

Skate Will Release in Early Access Next Month

In little more than two weeks, Skate will be released in early access by Electronic Arts. Earlier today, the team posted a small trailer to announce the release date:

For months, fans have been testing Skate (stylized as skate.) and running the game through its paces. This has meant that stacks of content have emerged online, giving us a fair indication of what to expect when San Vansterdam opens up on September 16, 2025.

Yesterday, the team revealed the cover art for Skate, promising that the early access release date would drop today. Well, as you can see from the above, they’ve delivered on that promise.

In June, the biggest update ever made to the playtest product was unveiled, adding more challenges and upping the server limit to 150 players per map. Even in a testing state, Skate featured a whopping 140 challenges and activities.

The full game could end up being something pretty monumental, scale-wise.

Will you be picking up Skate when it enters early access on September 16? Let me know what you’re most excited about with this game on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: When Did The IndyCar Deal Come Together With iRacing?
item.content:encoded:
On Tuesday, it was announced that iRacing and IndyCar had reached an agreement on a new game for the second half of 2026. The first console game in over 20 years for IndyCar, this new title is planned to launch on Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC via Steam.

But when did the deal come together?

Back in early 2024, iRacing president Tony Gardner told Insider Gaming that an IndyCar console game wasn’t in a “short-term plan” for the company, but that the door was open. Later that year, the door blew wide open.

Gardner says that while the long-term plan was to eventually get here, talks really picked up in late 2024.

“We finalized an agreement with them early this year,” Gardner told Insider Gaming, “So, it was six to nine months ago and, and we didn’t want to announce it too soon because we’d rather get some development under our belt and whatnot.”

As far as why announce the game now, Gardner said it made sense to do it ahead of the final race of the 2025 season on August 31.

“We need to to start talking more openly to the teams and getting driver feedback on the physics and things like that,” he said. “So it’s a good time for us to let the cat out of the bag.“

In addition to the console game, iRacing will continue to have a relationship with IndyCar on its main platform. The game is set to add the Dallara IL-15 from the INDY NXT series is set to join iRacing in season 4 of 2025.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Dust Devils Premium Warbond Release Date—Exact Start Times Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Helldivers 2’s long-awaited Xbox arrival is far from the end of the road, and a new Premium Warbond is right around the corner. Here, we’ve got all the details for the Dust Devils launch.

Though the Halo ODST Legendary Warbond understandably took the headlines following the Xbox launch, new content is coming thick and fast. The Dust Devils Warbond is just a part of this, which comes alongside the Into the Unjust update.

We’ve got all the details on the Helldivers 2 Dust Devils Warbond here, including the exact start time and what it includes.

Helldivers 2 Dust Devils Warbond Release Date & Start Times

The Dust Devils Premium Warbond in Helldivers 2 releases on September 4, with an exact start time of 2am PT.

Helldivers 2’s latest Premium Warbond is added in the days following the Into the Unjust update, with the store rotation on September 4 coming alongside the Dust Devils Warbond.

The release is slightly earlier than the Halo ODST Legendary Warbond, which was pushed back from the usual update time to align with the long-awaited release of Helldivers 2 on Xbox.

We’ve created the table below for easier viewing, showing the exact start times for the Dust Devils Warbond in Helldivers 2.

What to Expect in the Helldivers 2 Dust Devils Premium Warbond

The Dust Devils Premium Warbond in Helldivers 2 adds a bunch of new cosmetic items, including a new Armor, alongside key additions like new weapons and Stratagems.

In a post on the PlayStation blog, a breakdown stated the Dust Devils Warbond will include one primary weapon, a new throwable, and three unique Stratagems. Also included are Capes, Player Cards, an Emote, a Player title, and a new Pattern for your vehicles and Hellpods.

Here’s everything we know is included in the pass:

  • AR-2 Coyote Assault Rifle
  • G-7 Pineapple Cluster Frag Grenade
  • S-11 Speargun
  • EAT-700 Expendable Napalm
  • MS-11 Solo Silo
  • DS-42 Federation’s Blade
  • DS-191 Scorpion
  • Burier of Heads Title
  • Raider’s Cheer Emote
  • Rattlesnake Pattern
